data.name: Rolling Sums
data.description:
You are given an array of integers and an integer sum.

Your challenge is to find all the ways you can create that sum from consecutive sequences within the array.

For example:

```
rolling_sum([1,2,3,4,5],5) == 2 
# because you can add [2,3] and you already have [5]

rolling_sum([1,1,1,1,1],3) == 3 
# because you have the first 3 ones, the second 3 ones and the third 3 ones

rolling_sum([1,4,1,4,1], 7) == 0 
# because even though we could make 7, we can't do it with consecutive numbers
```

Brute force will work for the preliminary tests, but you'll have to do better for the ultimate challenge.

Be wary of the case where the sum == 0. It is non-trivial. Think about it like 

```
somestring.count('')
```
